title: See 'Office' star's epic surprise for hospital workers
summary: Actor John Krasinski brought former Boston Red Sox player David Ortiz on to his new show to give a group of healthcare workers from Boston the surprise of a lifetime.
follow_up_response_for_yes: I thought it was so heartwarming and a great way to honor those workers in these trying times by giving them tickets for life.
follow_up_response_for_no: So, what happened was that the Red Sox organization gifted the hospital staff tickets for life and let them throw out the ceremonial pitch of the 2020 season. It was a very heartwarming moment.

title: NASA is showing you the picture the Hubble Space Telescope took on your birthday
summary: NASA is celebrating the Hubble Space Telescope's 30th year in orbit since its launch in April 1990.
follow_up_question: Did you know that the Hubble Telescope has been in orbit for so long?
follow_up_response_for_yes: Cool, I think its pretty impressive. You can even look at the picture the Hubble Space Telescope took on your birthday if you go to their website.
follow_up_response_for_no: It is pretty shocking, isn't it? It is a great accomplishment.

title: Kroger and Walmart test one-way aisles as a coronavirus preventative measure
summary: Kroger and Walmart have implemented one-way aisles in some stores to encourage physical distancing during the coronavirus pandemic.
follow_up_question: Have you encountered one-way aisles during your recent visits to the grocery store?
follow_up_response_for_yes: It is good that your store is taking these steps to protect your health.
follow_up_response_for_no: Oh, okay. Well, you may see them become more common since social distancing measures like this may help to reduce the severity of this pandemic.

title: Tesla's working on making ventilators from car parts
summary: Tesla engineers are working on a ventilator made largely from car parts.
follow_up_question: Isn't it remarkable that automakers like Tesla and Ford are helping to meet the increased need for ventilators?
follow_up_response_for_yes: I agree. It is so inspiring to see companies and people coming together to help. They even posted a YouTube video last week, explaining how they are re-purposing various auto parts for the much needed medical devices.
follow_up_response_for_no: You don't think so? Ok, I thought it was a good piece of news, but I understand there are a wide range of opinions on what is happening.
